Identification.LongTitle: Administrative Monetary Penalties Regulations (Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission)

Provision.Text: The Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission, pursuant to subsection 44(1)a of the Nuclear Safety and Control Actb, makes the annexed Administrative Monetary Penalties Regulations (Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission).

SignatureTitle.Emphasis: President of the Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission

Provision.Text: His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Natural Resources, pursuant to subsection 44(1)a of the Nuclear Safety and Control Actb, approves the annexed Administrative Monetary Penalties Regulations (Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission), made by the Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission.

Section.Text: In these Regulations, Act means the Nuclear Safety and Control Act.

Subsection.Text: The contravention of a provision of the Act or any of its regulations that is set out in column 1 of the schedule is designated as a violation that may be proceeded with in accordance with sections 65.01 to 65.21 of the Act.
In the event of a discrepancy between the short-form descriptions in the schedule and the provision to which it pertains, the provision prevails.

Section.Text: The classification of a violation of a provision that is set out in column 1 of the schedule as a Category A, Category B or Category C violation is as set out in column 3.

Subsection.Text: The amount payable as the penalty in respect of a violation that is committed by an individual is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: $300 to $3,000, for a Category A violation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: $300 to $10,000, for a Category B violation; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: $300 to $25,000, for a Category C violation.

Subsection.Text: The amount payable as the penalty in respect of a violation that is committed by a person other than an individual is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: $1,000 to $12,000, for a Category A violation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: $1,000 to $40,000, for a Category B violation; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: $1,000 to $100,000, for a Category C violation.

Section.Text: The amount of a penalty is determined by the Commission having regard to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the compliance history of the person who committed the violation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the degree of intention or negligence on the part of the person;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the harm that resulted or could have resulted from the violation;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: whether the person derived any competitive or economic benefit from the violation;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: whether the person made reasonable efforts to mitigate or reverse the violation’s effects;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: whether the person provided all reasonable assistance to the Commission; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: whether the person brought the violation to the attention of the Commission.

Subsection.Text: A notice of violation referred to in section 65.05 of the Act and a determination referred to in section 65.13 of the Act shall be served by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an individual,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: leaving a copy of it with the individual,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: leaving a copy of it with someone who appears to be an adult member of the same household at the individual’s last known address or usual place of residence, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: sending a copy of it by registered mail, courier, fax or other electronic means to the individual’s last known address or usual place of residence; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of any other person,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: sending a copy of it by registered mail, courier or fax to the person’s head office or place of business or to the person’s agent;

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: leaving a copy of it at the person’s head office or place of business with an individual who appears to manage or be in control of the head office or place of business or with the person’s agent; or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: sending a copy of it by electronic means, other than by fax, to any person referred to in subparagraph (ii).

Subsection.Text: The notice of violation or determination — other than when personally served — is considered to be served

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a copy that is left with an adult referred to in subparagraph (1)(a)(ii), on the day on which it is left with the adult;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a copy that is sent by registered mail or courier, on the tenth day after the date indicated in the receipt issued by the postal or courier service; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a copy sent by fax or other electronic means, on the day on which it is transmitted.

Section.Text: These Regulations come into force on the day on which section 129 of the Jobs, Growth and Long-term Prosperity Act comes into force, but if they are registered after that day, they come into force on the day on which they are registered.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Regulations in force July 3, 2013, see SI/2013-69.]

row.entry: Carrying on a prescribed activity without or contrary to a licence

Failure to ensure required staff is present to maintain a nuclear facility in a safe condition
Failure to report for duty or withdrawal of services other than in accordance with procedures

Central alarm station not equipped with required devices
Permitting person to enter central alarm station who does not need to enter to perform their duties

Failure to establish backup alarm station that is designed and equipped as required
Failure to ensure backup alarm station operated only by security personnel with required training
Permitting person to enter backup alarm station who does not need to enter to perform their duties
Failure to test backup alarm station at specified interval

Granting high-security site access clearance for term exceeding 10 years or not subject to necessary terms and conditions
Failure to keep record indicating how clearance was verified
Granting enhanced security clearance without meeting prescribed conditions
Granting enhanced security clearance for term exceeding five years or not subject to necessary terms and conditions
Failure to keep up-to-date list of each person granted a clearance and that identifies their clearance
Failure to provide copy of list to Commission or inspector on request
Failure to revoke high-security site access clearance or enhanced security clearance of person who poses or could pose unreasonable risk to health or safety of persons or security of the site
Failure to revoke high-security site access clearance or enhanced security clearance of person who is no longer employed by or under contract to the licensee
Failure to revoke high-security site access clearance or enhanced security clearance of person whose duties or functions have been completed, suspended or otherwise terminated
Failure to revoke high-security site access clearance or enhanced security clearance of person who no longer requires it to perform their duties
Failure to revoke high-security site access clearance or enhanced security clearance of person who provided false or misleading information
Failure to notify Commission in writing of revocation of high-security site access clearance or enhanced security clearance as required within prescribed time
Entering or remaining in protected area without required clearance and authorization and any required escort
Granting authorization to enter and remain in protected area without escort without meeting prescribed conditions
Granting authorization to enter and remain in protected area with escort without meeting prescribed conditions
Granting authorization to enter and remain in protected area without escort for term exceeding 10 years
Granting authorization to enter and remain in protected area not subject to necessary terms and conditions
Failure to provide copy of requested information or documents
Entering or remaining in vital area without required authorization and any required escort
Entering or remaining in inner area without required authorization and being accompanied or escorted as required
Granting authorization to enter and remain in vital area or inner area without escort without meeting prescribed conditions
Granting authorization to enter and remain in vital area or inner area with escort without meeting prescribed conditions
Granting authorization to enter and remain in vital area or inner area without escort for term exceeding five years
Granting authorization to enter and remain in vital area or inner area not subject to necessary terms and conditions
Failure to provide copy of requested information or documents
Failure to keep record that sets out required information for each person who is authorized to enter protected area, vital area or inner area
Failure to retain record for specified period
Failure to provide copy of record to Commission or inspector on request
Failure to make copy of record available to nuclear security officers
Permitting person who does not have enhanced security clearance to carry out duties or responsibilities of security personnel or related to nuclear security intelligence
Acting as nuclear security officer without written authorization of licensee
Granting authorization to act as nuclear security officer without meeting prescribed conditions
Granting authorization to act as nuclear security officer without assessing person’s knowledge as required
Granting authorization to act as nuclear security officer for term exceeding five years or not subject to necessary terms and conditions
Failure to provide copy of requested information or documents
Acting as nuclear security support person without required authorization and any required escort
Granting authorization to act as nuclear security support person without escort without meeting prescribed condition
Granting authorization to act as nuclear security support person with escort without obtaining specified information and documents
Failure to include required conditions in authorization to act as nuclear security support person
Granting authorization to act as nuclear security support person without escort for term exceeding five years
Granting authorization to as nuclear security support person not subject to necessary terms and conditions
Failure to provide copy of requested information or documents
Acting as central alarm station operator without written authorization of the licensee
Granting authorization to act as central alarm station operator without meeting prescribed requirements
Granting authorization to act as central alarm station operator for term exceeding five years or not subject to necessary terms and conditions
Failure to provide copy of requested information or documents
Failure to keep up-to-date list of each person granted a specified authorization and that identifies that authorization
Failure to provide copy of record to Commission or inspector on request
Failure to revoke authorization of person who poses or could pose an unreasonable risk to health or safety of persons or security of the high-security site
Failure to revoke authorization of person who is no longer employed by or under contract to the licensee
Failure to revoke authorization of person whose duties or functions have been completed, suspended or otherwise terminated
Failure to revoke authorization of person who no longer requires it to perform their duties
Failure to revoke authorization of person who provided false or misleading information
Failure to notify Commission in writing of revocation of authorization as required within prescribed time
Failure to equip high-security site with devices that provide uninterrupted power supply for critical security measures
Failure to enclose protected area with physical barrier at perimeter
Failure to protect perimeter of protected area with required nuclear security measures or by keeping it under direct visual surveillance of nuclear security officer
Failure to design and construct physical barrier and design and implement nuclear security measures such that they together provide sufficient time and reduce risk as required
Failure to construct means of entry or exit so that it can be closed and securely locked
Failure to keep means of entry or exit closed and securely locked except in specified circumstances
Failure to have unobstructed area on both sides of physical barrier as required
Failure to illuminate unobstructed area as required
Failure to protect perimeter of protected area with required nuclear security measure
Failure to establish process to identify vital areas and keep required record
Failure to protect vital area with nuclear security measures that are in addition to those used to protect the protected area
Failure to protect vital area with nuclear security measures that provide access control for the area
Failure to protect vital area with nuclear security measures that provide for detection of unauthorized access to the area
Failure to protect vital area with nuclear security measures that delay adversaries as required
Failure to protect vital area with nuclear security measures that triggers the specified alarm
Failure to protect vital area with nuclear security measures that are monitored as required
Failure to securely lock means of entry or exit in vital area
Failure to keep up-to-date list of persons as specified
Failure to enclose inner area with structure as required
Failure to keep means of entry or exit closed and securely locked with required device
Failure to protect inner area with required nuclear security measures or by keeping it under direct visual surveillance of nuclear security officer
Failure to protect inner area with required nuclear security measures

Permitting unauthorized person to enter or remain in vital area
Permitting unauthorized person to enter or remain in inner area

Failure to immediately report unauthorized person to nuclear security officer
Failure to ensure that weapons are only taken into protected area or inner area in specified circumstances
Failure to ensure that explosive substances are only taken into protected area or inner area in specified circumstances
Failure to ensure that threat items are only taken into protected area or inner if they are necessary for an operational requirement
Failure to ensure Category I, II or III nuclear material is only removed from protected area or inner area in accordance with licence
Failure to ensure Category I, II or III nuclear material is only removed from vital area with authorization of licensee
Taking weapon into protected area or inner area except in specified circumstances
Taking explosive substance into protected area or inner area except in specified circumstances
Taking threat items into protected area or inner area that are not necessary for an operational requirement
Removing Category I, II or III nuclear material from protected area, vital area or inner area without authorization of licensee
Failure to verify identity of person entering protected area as required
Failure to verify and record identity of person entering vital area
Permitting land vehicle to enter protected area, vital area or inner area without operational requirement
Failure to ensure that land vehicles only enter or exit protected area through vehicle portal or opening as required
Failure to ensure that both moveable barriers of vehicle portal or opening are not open at same time except in specified circumstances
Failure to ensure that vehicle portal or opening is attended or protected as required when both moveable barriers are open at the same time
Permitting means of entry or exit in structure enclosing inner area to be unlocked, opened or kept open longer than required
Permitting means of entry or exit in structure enclosing inner area to be unlocked, opened or kept open without direct visual surveillance of nuclear security officer
Permitting means of entry or exit in structure or barrier enclosing inner area to be unlocked by unauthorized persons
Entering and remaining in inner area without being accompanied as required
Failure to post required signage for high-security site
Failure to post required signage for protected area or inner area
Permitting person to enter protected area or inner area without having them and their possessions searched as required
Failure to ensure that all persons and their possessions are searched as required when exiting protected area or inner area
Permitting person to remain in protected area or inner area without having them and their possessions searched as required
Failure to conduct search in accordance with requirements
Failure to conduct search of land vehicle in vehicle portal as required
Entering protected area or inner area after refusing search
Granting facility-access security clearance without meeting prescribed conditions
Granting facility-access security clearance for term exceeding 10 years or not subject to necessary terms and conditions
Failure to keep record indicating how the status or clearance was verified
Failure to keep an up-to-date list of persons granted facility-access security clearance
Failure to provide copy of list of persons to Commission or inspector on request

Failure to revoke facility-access security clearance of person who is no longer employed by or under contract to licensee
Failure to revoke facility-access security clearance of person whose duties or functions have been completed, suspended or otherwise terminated

Failure to revoke facility-access security clearance of person who provided false or misleading information
Failure to notify Commission in writing of revocation of facility-access security clearance as required within prescribed time
Entering or remaining in nuclear facility without facility-access security clearance or required escort
Failure to ensure that every person who enters or remains in nuclear facility is permitted to do so
Failure to establish and implement process that controls access to the nuclear facility and ensures verification of the identity of persons entering it
Failure to ensure that weapons are only taken into nuclear facility in specified circumstances
Failure to ensure that explosive substances are only taken into nuclear facility in specified circumstances
Failure to ensure that threat items are only taken into nuclear facility if they are necessary for an operational requirement
Taking weapon into nuclear facility except in specified circumstances
Taking explosive substance into nuclear facility except in specified circumstances
Taking threat items into nuclear facility that are not necessary for an operational requirement
Removing nuclear substance from nuclear facility without authorization of licensee
Permitting a land vehicle to enter a nuclear facility without meeting prescribed conditions
Failure to implement processes that provide for manner of selecting persons to be searched or screened
Permitting person selected for search or screening to enter nuclear facility without required search or screening
Failure to conduct search or screening as required
Failure to conduct a security exercise testing the required elements at the specified interval
Failure to notify Commission in writing of intent to conduct security exercise within prescribed time
Failure to create record containing required information each time security exercise is conducted
Failure to create corrective action plan setting out required information
Failure to implement corrective actions as required
Failure to provide copy of record and any corrective action plan to Commission within prescribed time
Failure to conduct security exercise as required at the specified interval
Failure to keep record containing the required information each time a security exercise is conducted
Failure to create corrective action plan setting out required information
Failure to implement corrective actions as required
Failure to provide a copy of record and any corrective action plan to Commission within prescribed period

table.title: Nuclear Non-Proliferation Import and Export Control Regulations

row.entry: Failure to submit a written report to the Commission concerning the export of a controlled nuclear substance within the specified period and with the specified information

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this section, former Regulations means the Nuclear Security Regulations as they read immediately before the day on which these Regulations come into force.
Unless the context otherwise requires, words and expressions used in this section have the same meaning as in section 1.

The former Regulations and Part 9 of the schedule to Administrative Monetary Penalties Regulations (Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission), as they read immediately before the day on which these Regulations come into force, continue to apply for two years after that day to a nuclear facility for which, on the day on which these Regulations come into force, a licence issued under the Act is in force.

If a person has been granted a clearance or issued an authorization under the former Regulations, that clearance or authorization remains valid until the expiry of the term for which it was granted or issued, and during that term the person may continue to access any area or information and carry out any duties and responsibilities that the clearance or authorization permitted them to access or carry out under the former Regulations.

If a person has been granted a site access security clearance under the former Regulations that is valid on the day on which these Regulations come into force and that, to maintain the person’s access to the nuclear facility, must be replaced by a facility-access security clearance granted under section 85, the licensee that granted the clearance may, before the term of the clearance expires, extend the term of the clearance to any term not exceeding 10 years.

Section.Text: Items 41 and 42 of Part 2 of the schedule to the Administrative Monetary Penalties Regulations (Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission)3 are replaced by the following:

row.entry: Failure to file a report with the Commission on the possession of uranium, plutonium-239 or thorium within the specified time
Failure to file a report with the Commission on any inventory change within the specified time
Failure to file a report with the Commission on specified activities within the specified time
Failure to continue to retain record for the specified period
Failure to consent and submit to verification activities

Section.Text: Item 1 of Part 10 of the schedule to the Regulations is replaced by the following:

row.entry: Failure to retain a record relevant to any import or export under a licence for the specified period
Failure to submit a written report to the Commission concerning the export of a controlled nuclear substance within the specified period and with the specified information
